page.title: 07AIRDRIE FAIR DAY.
page.content: IN JUNE 1985 THE ANNUAL FAIR WAS HELD.AIRDRIE WAS GRANTED LICENCE TO HAVE ANNUAL FAIRS IN 1695.AS IN THE OLD DAYS,THERE WERE MANY OPEN STALLS PLACED IN THE TOWN CENTRE WHICH WAS PEDESTRIANISED FOR EIGHT HOURS.THERE WAS THE USUAL DISPLAY OF HIGHLAND DANCING,MUSIC BY VARIOUS BANDS INCLUDING THE LOCAL BRASS BAND.THERE WERE ALSO OTHER DISPLAYS EG. AN ARMY RIFLE RANGE & VARIOUS COMPETITIONS SUCH AS QUIZZES AND CHESS.NOWADAYS THERE IS NO LIVESTOCK SOLD. IT WAS NOT SO SUCCESSFUL THIS YEAR AS IT WAS "AUFY CAULD"(AWFUL COLD).IN THE EVENING THERE WAS A SPECIAL NIGHT IN THE SIR JOHN WILSON TOWN HALL. TODAY'S AIRDRIONIANS,LIKE YESTERYEAR'S,ENJOY FINISHING THEIR FAIR DAY WITH DANCING.
